title: The Open Door. 1987.
description: The Open Door was a Bloomington-based publication that covered gay and lesbian community news and commentary in the area.

New Horizons Gay Community Servies. 1975-76.
creator: Collin C. Schwoyer (Founder)
description: New Horizons Gay Community Services was one of the first spaces specifically for gay and lesbian people in Bloomington. Founded in 1975 by then-graduate student Collin Schwoyer, the space on 809 S. Rogers Street held weekly activities at least through 1976, and possibly beyond then.

title: News Horizons vol. 1 no. 1
description: The first publication of the News Horizons newsletter.

description: A flyer for the Grand Opening Week of New Horizons Gay Community Services.

title: Patrons expelled from bar for same-sex dancing
creator: Karin Hoyer

title: Gay Liberation Front Valentines Day Dance. 1975.
creator: Rick Shulte
description: The Gay Liberation Front (GLF) organized a Valentines Day "Coming-out" party at the Holiday Inn West in Bloomington.
subject: Recreation

title: Lesbopalooza. 1997.
description: Several Lesbopalooza events were organized at IU-Bloomington in the 1990s. The 1997 edition was held at Collins Center and saw 400-500 showgoers.
subject: Recreation; Student

title: Groups gather in opposition to anti-gay demonstrations.
subject: Collective Action; Student

title: Indiana Cares honors Bloomington Couple. 1996.
creator: Gary Pool
description: A Bloomington couple, Doris and Bob Fox, were honored by AIDS advocacy group Indiana Cares. Their son, Tom, died of AIDS-related complications in 1989, and the couple would go on to lead the development of AIDS groups and champion acceptance and action among parents of homosexual children.
subject: AIDS; Parenting

title: Lobbying against partner policy for unmarried couples
subject: Parenting; Equal Rights; Protest

title: Bloomington Gay Alliance newsletters. 1979-1981.
description: The Bloomington Gay Alliance, later named the Bloomington Gay and Lesbian Alliance, was an umbrella organization facilitated many smaller groups and collective action initiatives in the 1970s and 80s.

title: GLB Office viewing party for Ellen DeGeneres' coming out
description: The GLB Office at IU held an event for Ellen DeGeneres' coming-out on her ABC Sitcom Ellen. The event was held at Bloomington Bagel Company.
subject: Coming Out; Recreation
community: Gay; Lesbian; Bisexual; Gay Lesbian & Bisexual (GLB)

title: I DEMAND RECOGNITION sticker
creator: ZERO TOLERANCE: Queers United for the Center
description: This "I DEMAND RECOGNITION" sticker is part of the wide array of student initiatives aimed at securing a resource center for LGBTQ+ students on the IU Bloomington campus. The center would officially open in 1994.
subject: LGBTQ+ Culture Center; Student; Collective Action

title: Aquarious Books Volunteer's letter to playwright Sarah Dreher
Community discouse in the Herald-Times following anti-gay demonstrations. 1975.
description: Sizeable religious anti-gay demonstrations in Bloomington led concerned locals to pay for an advertisement discussing biblical interpretation. Two responses in disagreement were submitted in the following issue. 1975.
subject: Religion; Collective Action
